law_name: THE INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY ORGANIZATION OF PAKISTAN ACT

sections.body: (1) This Act may be called the Intellectual Property Organization of Pakistan Act, 2012. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force with effect from the 28th August, 2012 except the provisions of section 15, 16, 17, 18 and 19 which shall come into force on such date as the Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.

In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, various definitions are provided including 'Board', 'Chairman', 'Code', 'Director General', 'employee', 'Fund', 'Intellectual Property', 'Intellectual Property Laws', 'Member', 'offence', 'Organization', 'prescribed', 'rules', 'regulations', 'Secretary', 'Schedule', and 'Tribunal'.

(1) There shall be established an Organization to be known as Intellectual Property Organization of Pakistan to carry out the purposes of this Act. (2) The Organization shall be an autonomous body having perpetual succession and a common seal with powers, subject to the provisions of this Act, to hold and dispose of property both movable and immovable.

(1) The Federal Government shall constitute a Policy Board of the Organization consisting of the Chairman and fourteen other Members. (2) The Board shall consist of five Members from the public sector, five Members from the private sector, and four Members from the provinces.
The Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, increase or decrease the number of Members of the Board and issue directions to the Organization.

(1) The Board shall be responsible for setting objectives and policy guidelines of the Organization. (2) The Board shall take policy decisions and advise the Federal Government on all matters relating to intellectual property.
The Board may delegate all or any of its powers and functions to the Chairman.
(1) The meetings of the Board shall be convened by the Chairman. (2) The Board shall meet not less than two times in a calendar year.
(1) There shall be a Chairman of the Organization to be appointed by the Federal Government for a term of three years.

sections.section_title: Privileges and perquisites of the Members
sections.body: The Members other than public sector Members shall be entitled to such privileges and perquisites as may be prescribed.

sections.section_title: Functions and powers of the Chairman
sections.body: The Chairman shall preside over the meetings of the Board and has various powers and functions as prescribed.
The Director-General shall be appointed under Section 12.
